intro: Hypodematium subglabrum, commonly known as the smooth hypodematium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions of Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Hypodematium subglabrum is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
